edu.uci.inf111.SelfCheckOut.Devices
Class BaggingArea

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.inf111.SelfCheckOut.Devices.BaggingArea

public class BaggingArea
extends java.lang.Object

The BaggingArea class represents a wrapper for a hardware driver of the sensors in a bagging area. Because we're not really using such a device, our class provides methods to change the weight reported by the bagging area, and to zero that weight if we're resetting the system.

The BaggingArea uses an Observer (or Listener) design pattern. Objects which implement the BaggingAreaListener interface may use the attach() method to register with the BaggingArea. When a weight change event occurs, the BaggingArea reports the event to its observers using their notify methods. In this example, we do not support detaching from the BaggingArea.

In the business logic of our system (implemented in SelfCheckOut) we use known product weights to ascertain if the customer has placed an item in the bagging area after scanning it. Until we see a (correct) weight change, we would keep telling them to bag the item, and we would refuse to accept scans of additional items.

Constructor Summary
BaggingArea()
          This simple constructor initializes a zero weight and an empty set of observers.

Constructor Detail

BaggingArea

public BaggingArea()
This simple constructor initializes a zero weight and an empty set of observers.

Method Detail

getTotalWeight

public double getTotalWeight()
Returns the current weight being registered by the bagging area 'sensor'.

changeWeight

public void changeWeight(double weight)
changeWeight() is the method we use to simulate the bagging area scales detecting a change in weight. This is a gross simplification, but will suffice for our system. A small time delay is included to represent the time taken by the action. Note that a negative weight corresponds to the customer removing an item from the bagging area.

Parameters:
weight - The amount of weight change in this event.

zeroWeight

public void zeroWeight()
The zeroWeight() method zeroes the scales of the BaggingArea, simulating the customer leaving with their purchases.

attach

public void attach(BaggingAreaListener bal)
The attach() method registers a BaggingreaListener to receive all future BaggingAreaEvents.

Parameters:
bal - The Listener (often the calling object) to be attached.
